Member Function Documentation

virtual bool sxsdk::creator_interface::accepts_disk ( void *  aux = 0  )  const [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Return whether to accept disk dragging operation in the Figure window.

accepts_sphere(), accepts_disk(), accepts_rectangle(), and accepts_translation() cannot be used simultaneously. If this function returns true, other functions must return false.

Get drag results with set_disk().

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

virtual bool sxsdk::creator_interface::accepts_rectangle ( void *  aux = 0  )  const [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Return whether to accept rectangle dragging operation in the Figure window.

accepts_sphere(), accepts_disk(), accepts_rectangle(), and accepts_translation() cannot be used simultaneously. If this function returns true, other functions must return false.

Get drag results with set_rectangle().

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

virtual bool sxsdk::creator_interface::accepts_sphere ( void *  aux = 0  )  const [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Return whether to accept sphere dragging operation in the Figure window.

accepts_sphere(), accepts_disk(), accepts_rectangle(), and accepts_translation() cannot be used simultaneously. If this function returns true, other functions must return false.

Get drag results with set_sphere().

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

virtual bool sxsdk::creator_interface::accepts_translation ( void *  aux = 0  )  const [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Return whether to accept translation dragging operation in the figure window.

accepts_sphere(), accepts_disk(), accepts_rectangle(), and accepts_translation() cannot be used at the same time. If this function returns true, these other functions must return false.

Get drag results with set_translation().

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

void *  aux = 0

Overridable.

virtual bool sxsdk::creator_interface::create ( sxsdk::scene_interface *  scene,
void *  aux = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Overridable. This function is called after (if so specified) dragging operation and dialog box. You can override this function and implement object creation.

Returns true if any change in the scene occurs, otherwise returns false.

Parameters:
scene the target scene
virtual void sxsdk::creator_interface::make_wireframe ( sxsdk::shape_class &  shape,
const sxsdk::mat4 &  mat,
int  view,
int  flags,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. This function is called when Shade displays the shape's wireframe. The default behavior is to do nothing, but you can override this function and add your own wireframe display.

If the plugin ID is passed to the argument wireframe_id with sxsdk::shape_class::create_attribute_stream_interface_with_uuid() and generates an attribute stream, this function is called for that object.

By making a direct OpenGL command within this function, you can construct an independent wireframe. Because this affects the whole processing speed, only drawing wireframes within this function is recommended. Also, processes that modify the scene are not guaranteed.

Parameters:
shape the target object
mat the local to world coordinate matrix
view the target drawing view (0: Side 1: Front 2: Top 3: Pers)
flags the flag that determines Bounding mode or Pick mode

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

virtual bool sxsdk::creator_interface::pre_create ( sxsdk::scene_interface *  scene,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. This function is called after the creator plugin has been started and before the user starts to drag the mouse.

Used to display a dialog and apply settings etc. before doing a user drag.

Parameters:
scene the target scene

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.
